review_blob: Smells somewhat woody, and pours deep cloudy amber with a strong head. Its a very strong double ipa (9.7). Leaves a slightly orangey feel in the mouth on drinking perhaps a hint of caramel, for a strong double ipa its not got as much character as I would expect.
beer_name: Weird Beard Heaven And Hell Batch 2

review_blob:
A good tasty session beer served with a strong head leaving a nice lace down the glass. Amber and clear in colour with a strong start and slightly sulphurous bite afterwards. 

Slight cameral notes. An all round great bitter ale.
A sharp taste at first to follow a nice slightly floral nose. Fruity with a light acidic after taste. Clear to the eye, very good from the bottle.

One of my best ales. A cloudy orange ale with a heavy sweet taste with a medium bitter aftertaste that sticks on the tongue. Little or no carbonation. The hops in this ale kick in very quickly, when poured correctly a good strong head is left for the duration.

Good served from the pump and from a live bottle. Although hard to source bottled in the UK due to Arbors insistence on selling it to the foreign market first.
